captions.text:
Good morning John, it’s Wednesday. I’m
in bed because I feel really bad. Yesterday

I felt fine at 8 o’clock and then by 9 o’clock
I had a 101 degree fever and a sore throat

and a sinus headache and all of my skin hurt
to touch, so I felt like not having anything
touch me.

Then I wanted to go to bed so I did. And then
I woke up about 25 different times because

I was having the same dream over and over
again about having to build a satellite of

Lego pieces with an incompetent team of jerks
who didn’t know how to build a satellite.

It was really embarrassing that our satellite
was so bad. And I had that dream all night

long, the same dream, over and over again,
and I really didn’t like it, and I had to
pee a lot.

I did get my computer so that I could be awake
and do things while in bed. I love that you

can do that nowadays. You can totally be a
productive citizen without ever having to
leave your bed.

I watched episodes of Tiny Toon Adventures
which I love that show, so I came to have

the fun with Yakko, Wakko and Dot and Bu-Babs
and Buster Bunny and Pinky and The Brain,

and this is a... stuffed animal that I was
cuddling with.

Why is it a strike when you miss the ball?
In baseball why isn’t it... you strike,

like if I strike you, you don’t say I struck
you if I missed. It doesn't make any sense.

And I also spent some time exploring Your
Pants, and I found some of my favorite threads

in the history of all forums ever. Like this
one that you can click in the doobly-doo about

how, uh, sciency people to blow minds. It’s
great. And then this one, there was a thread

for people from Palestine and people from
Israel and then the people in those in that

thread decided that they should collaborate
and be one thread. Middle East peace in Your
Pants.

And I also really liked this one in which
people talk about how they became nerdfighters.

Everybody finds these videos a different way,
and there’s a million billion ways to do

it and there’s one person for every way
to do it cause there’s a million billion
of you. Hi!

Sometimes I feel like we’ve been unfair
to the giraffes, John. I think that we can
make it up to them.

Additionally, I have some great news if you
live in Seattle or Portland, I am going to

be in Seattle or Portland next month, Marchy
times, and I don’t know exactly when but

I’ll put the information in the describy
boob.

Uuuuuuuooghuuhhh. I’m gonna go to bed. John,
I’ll see you on Fridaaaay. Uuuuuuuhhh.

title: This Video Brought to you by Nyquil

comments.text: Ahh, poor Hank. ﻿

comments.author: Nathalia Arcos

comments.text:
Discovered Vlogbrothers about a month ago. I was watching Healthcare Triage 
on Obama Care (I believe) and saw a link to an episode of Vlogbrothers in 
which John is talking about Obama Care. 
I went on watching vids and after a while I thought: 'I am a nerdfighter'. 
And also: 'How did I get here' Now I have binge watched the years 2007-here 
and 2015 as well as several videos from the remaining years.

Just wish I had discovered this when I was in highschool, when it started 
in stead of now. But hey, it doesn't make it less awesome. And I vividly 
remember hearing the exclamation: 'French the llama' when I was still in 
highschool. Now I know where it came from :D﻿
comments.author: mythologiefan

comments.text:
I found nerdfighteria because of science.  I subscribe to several science 
channels on youtube and one day came across SciShow in the recommended 
videos.  After watching as many of those as I could, I noticed Hank in the 
thumbnails for videos from a channel called Vlogbrothers and decided to 
give it a try.﻿

comments.author: Raven the Reshiram

comments.text:
I don't care how old this video is, I'm still commenting. I found 
Nerdfighteria roughly a year ago. First, my history teacher showed a Crash 
Course US History video in class, and then soon after that I read TFiOS. 
And I was thinking, Wow, this guy is really cool, he is so accomplished 
(John). Then, my science teacher showed a SciShow video in class, and again 
I was thinking, This guy is really cool too (Hank). A friend of mine then 
informed me that YOU TWO WERE RELATED! I Googled you, and praise Google, I 
discovered vlogbrothers. You guys completely understand how I think. I 
don't really have any nerdy friends, so it's nice to have two nerds who I 
can nerd out whenever I need to, and that's a great thing. Even if you guys 
are behind that camera in your homes or airports or hotels, and I'll 
probably never get to meet either of you in person, I'm grateful for you 
both and Nerdfighteria in general for giving me a place where I can show 
this other side of me my school friends don't really get to see.﻿
comments.author: Giulia Socolof

channel. ﻿

comments.text:
*WARNING! IF YOU READ THIS, YOU'LL BASICALLY BE READING MY THOUGHT PROCESS 
OF TRYING TO FIGURE OUT WHEN AND HOW I STARTED WATCHING JOHN AND HANK!* I 
have absolutely no clue how I found the Vlogbrothers channel. it wasn't 
because of any of their other stuff, and no one recommended it to me. I 
wasn't even a hardcore watcher until I decided to watch all of the VB's 
videos from start to end. Ugh, now I'm sitting here trying to remember when 
I started watching these. It was around the making of the TFIOS movie, 
because my little sister's friend was in it and I wanted to see if he 
mentioned her at all. She was the young Hazel, and he didn't. Let's 
see....I read my first John Green book like three years ago, and it was 
TFIOS. I wasn't watching Vlogbrothers then. The movie was announced in 
2013, by which I still wasn't watching. Wait, no. I remember this person 
walking down the bus aisle with a DFTBA shirt and I knew what it meant. So 
I definitely started watching when I was a sophomore (last year). BUT WHEN? 
I think the first video I watched was sharpie face, where John talks about 
crazy eyes. Oh my god. I honestly cannot remember, and I don't even know if 
the aforementioned memories are true! Well, I tried, Nerdfighters. I guess 
my only estimate is that I found the channel around the time that sharpie 
video came out. What a journey this has been, eh?﻿
comments.author: Zach Dragg

comments.text: oh poor hank...﻿

My teacher (who I hated and who hated me) showed us a CGP Grey video. I 
came home, watched it again. A year later I remembered it and watched it 
again, and then kept on watching until I came to the one about Digital 
Aristotle (you should watch it) and one of the links in the video was to 
SciShow, the one about the fake evolution picture, and I loved it, and I 
kept on watching until one of the YouTube suggestions was a vlogbrothers 
video, and then I've just been watching!﻿

comments.text:
I hate how vague my "How I became a Nerdfighter" story is. I dont remember 
how I found out about it, but I started watching Mental Floss when the MF 
channel first started, and then one day I saw a clip of Hanks rant video on 
YouTube, when he said "To those who complain about chemicals being in their 
food...EVERYTHING IS CHEMICALS" It made me laugh way too hard, for way to 
long, and I wanted to see the rest of it, but had to do something so I 
"Watch later"'d the video. 
Later I saw Charlie post about "John-ning" and realized it was about "the 
guy from Mental Floss"  so, I looked up John, found Hanks rant video, 
watched it, and finally all the dots connected and I just kept clicking 
videos. ﻿

comments.author: Rachael Dye

comments.text:
Oh my goodness, the sick rant -- speech patterns and logic and progression 
of topics, et cetera -- is almost exactly what I am like when my meds wear 
off and the EDS kicks in. Luckily, for me that is not painful, and just 
silly, but it's...it's not...sober. I just don't have a functioning brain; 
it turns into Jello. If I were in that state, that would have me say that 
Jello isn't even kosher, and I would then start to slur about something 
incoherent which I would, myself, understand so little that the internal 
consistency would not even be a thought.﻿
